skill.name: expo-cicd-workflows
skill.description: Helps understand and write EAS workflow YAML files for Expo projects. Use this skill when the user asks about CI/CD or workflows in an Expo or EAS context, mentions .eas/workflows/, or wants help with EAS build pipelines or deployment automation.
skill.summary: Helps write and validate EAS workflow YAML files for Expo CI/CD pipelines. Fetches official schema and documentation for accurate workflow generation.
skill.author: expo

security_audit.summary: Static analysis detected patterns related to network calls and shell examples. Evaluation confirms these are legitimate: network access is limited to official Expo documentation endpoints, shell examples are documentation strings (not executable), and SHA-256 is a secure hashing algorithm. No malicious intent found. Safe for publication.

low_findings.title: Network Calls to Official Expo Endpoints
low_findings.description: The skill fetches documentation from official Expo resources. These are intentional, documented network calls for schema retrieval.
low_findings.confidence_reasoning: Direct evidence shows hardcoded URLs to official Expo documentation endpoints (api.expo.dev, raw.githubusercontent.com/expo/expo) - legitimate documentation fetching.

dangerous_patterns.title: Documentation Examples Misidentified as Commands
dangerous_patterns.description: Static analyzer flagged shell examples in documentation as backtick execution. These are markdown documentation strings, not actual code.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: The flagged lines are markdown code blocks showing command examples to users - not executable backticks. No actual shell execution occurs.

dangerous_patterns.title: SHA-256 Hashing for Cache Keys
dangerous_patterns.description: Static analyzer flagged SHA-256 as weak. SHA-256 is a secure cryptographic hash standard, not weak.
dangerous_patterns.confidence_reasoning: SHA-256 is used for URL-to-cache-key hashing, which is an appropriate and secure use case. This is a false positive.

content.user_title: Create and validate EAS CI/CD workflows
content.value_statement: Expo developers struggle to write correct EAS workflow YAML files due to complex schema requirements. This skill fetches the official schema, provides syntax guidance, and validates workflow files against the latest specifications.
actual_capabilities: Generate EAS workflow YAML files from requirements
Fetch the official EAS schema for current job types and parameters
Validate workflow files against the official schema
Explain workflow structure, triggers, jobs, and expressions
Debug workflow validation errors and suggest fixes
limitations: Does not execute workflows or interact with EAS CLI directly
Cannot create or modify Expo project files outside workflow YAML
Does not provision EAS build credentials or secrets
Does not submit apps to app stores

use_cases.title: New EAS Workflow Setup
use_cases.description: A developer wants to set up automated builds for their Expo app. The skill helps create a workflow file with development and preview builds triggered on pull requests.
use_cases.target_user: Expo developers new to EAS CI/CD

use_cases.title: Workflow Validation
use_cases.description: A team has written workflow YAML and wants to verify it conforms to the current schema before committing. The skill validates and reports any errors.

use_cases.title: Workflow Troubleshooting
use_cases.description: A workflow is failing validation. The skill reviews the errors, explains what each means, and suggests corrections based on the official schema.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Workflow Generation
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an EAS workflow file for my Expo app. I want builds to run automatically when I push to main or open a pull request. Include a job that builds for development and another for production builds.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow with Conditions
prompt_templates.prompt: Write an EAS workflow that only runs production builds when files in the app/ directory change. Skip production builds for documentation-only changes.

prompt_templates.title: Workflow Validation
prompt_templates.prompt: Validate my workflow file at .eas/workflows/build.yml against the official EAS schema. Report any errors and suggest fixes.

prompt_templates.title: Custom Job with Dependencies
prompt_templates.prompt: Create an EAS workflow with three jobs: lint, build, and test. The build job should only run after lint passes. All jobs should run on the latest Ubuntu image.

output_examples.input: Create an EAS workflow with a development build triggered on pull requests
output: - Steps: Install dependencies, Install EAS CLI, Run eas build

best_practices: Always validate workflow files against the official schema before committing
Fetch the latest schema when creating workflows for new Expo SDK versions
Use conditional triggers to skip unnecessary builds and save resources
Reference job outputs using the needs context for multi-job workflows
anti_patterns: Hardcoding specific OS versions instead of using runner aliases like 'ubuntu-latest'
Skipping validation and committing workflow files with schema errors
Creating monolithic single-job workflows instead of splitting into lint, build, test
Not using conditions to filter when builds run for different changes

faq.question: What is EAS Workflow?
faq.answer: EAS Workflow is a CI/CD system for Expo apps. It defines automated tasks (jobs) that run when triggers like pull requests occur. Workflows are YAML files in .eas/workflows/.

faq.question: How do I create my first EAS workflow?
faq.answer: Describe your requirements to Claude with this skill active. The skill will fetch the schema, generate a valid YAML file, and help you validate it before committing.

faq.question: What triggers can I use for EAS workflows?
faq.answer: EAS workflows support 'pull_request', 'push', and 'workflow_dispatch' triggers. Use conditions to filter when specific jobs run based on changed files or branch names.

faq.question: Can I run workflows locally?
faq.answer: EAS workflows run on Expo's infrastructure. For local testing, use 'eas build --local' or run equivalent commands manually. The skill focuses on workflow YAML, not execution.

faq.question: How do I validate my workflow file?
faq.answer: Use the validation script: 'node scripts/validate.js .eas/workflows/your-workflow.yml'. The skill includes this script to fetch the latest schema and check for errors.

faq.question: What job types does EAS support?
faq.answer: EAS supports 'build' jobs for native builds, 'custom' jobs with custom commands, and 'eas' jobs for internal Expo processes. Fetch the schema to see current options.
